intro: Diplycosia consobrina, commonly known as the rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, evergreen leaves and produces clusters of white or pink flowers during the spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
